Key Arguments: The proposal undermines representative government by giving power to an unelected body.
There is no clear authority on what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Innovation requires a free marketplace of ideas, which could be stifled by such regulation.
Individuals have the right to be wrong and learn from consequences, unlike an unelected body.
The proposal could lead to a totalitarian control over information.
Notable Quotes: The only weapon against misinformation and disinformation is more information.
By handing over the power to ACMA to act on perceived misinformation and disinformation, we would cede power over the past.
